text: Hey guys, I’m trying to run workshop to test if my toast works and I’m getting 401 errors when trying to preview the wallpaper. Anybody else getting that?
soooooo per <@U0261PCRQ> "All requests to the Google Drive API must be authorized by an authenticated user.” <https://developers.google.com/drive/web/about-auth>
which means we’d need to handle accounts / logins, which adam has historically been cagey on
right. i think we need to make sure he's aware. it has UX implications all over the place
could/should we do all requests from Jane Google
and not have any access in the app?

```Getting back into workshop, we’ve been talking through the Moments / Drive integration issues, and wanted to run some things by you:

- Even in a public folder, in order to use the Drive API, all requests must be done via an authenticated user. We, in theory, could obfuscate this by having all requests from a hidden “google user”, otherwise we would need to add account management / access to the app, which I know has been a concern in the past
- Alternatively, we could nix the drive integration and have all photos be local– when creating a case, the user would presumably upload N photos, and when activating the case, we’d get a manifest of the locations of those photos, and be able to download them to a local folder. The user could then manage and add to this local folder, and not worry about any authentication or external folder management.

The drive integration has a number of UX issues (folder creation if not there, access control changes, account management, etc) that might not be worth it for, what I imagine is the main use case: just having the photos you uploaded on your device.
```
Thoughts?
